p: The number of pups in the three major colonies in Baja California in 2009 was estimated to be n = 5,174. Fifty-nine percent of births occurred in the Guadalupe colony, 33% in San Benito, and 8% in Cedros (see Table 1). Forty-one more pups were reported at Coronados Islands (27 pups), Todos Santos Islands (10), San Martín Island (3), and San Jerónimo Island (1) [ 21] (see Fig 1).
